Title: Burlesque
Actors: Cher, Christina Aguilera, Eric Dane, Cam Gigandet
Plot: A small-town girl ventures to Los Angeles and finds her place in a neo-burlesque club run by a former dancer.
Awards: Won 1 Golden Globe. Another 4 wins & 14 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Campy and clichéd, Burlesque wastes its talented cast (including a better-than-expected Christina Aguilera) on a movie that wavers uncertainly between "bad" and "so bad it's good."

Title: Season of the Witch
Actors: Nicolas Cage, Ron Perlman, Stephen Campbell Moore, Stephen Graham
Plot: 14th-century knights transport a suspected witch to a monastery, where monks deduce her powers could be the source of the Black Plague.
tomatoConsensus: Slow, cheap-looking, and dull, Season of the Witch fails even as unintentional comedy.

Title: Old Dogs
Actors: John Travolta, Robin Williams, Kelly Preston, Conner Rayburn
Plot: Two friends and business partners find their lives turned upside down when strange circumstances lead to them being placed in the care of 7-year-old twins.
tomatoConsensus: Its cast tries hard, but Old Dogs is a predictable, nearly witless attempt at physical comedy and moral uplift that misses the mark on both counts.

Title: The Last Airbender
Actors: Noah Ringer, Dev Patel, Nicola Peltz, Jackson Rathbone
Plot: The story follows the adventures of Aang, a young successor to a long line of Avatars, who must put his childhood ways aside and stop the Fire Nation from enslaving the Water, Earth and Air nations.
tomatoConsensus: The Last Airbender squanders its popular source material with incomprehensible plotting, horrible acting, and detached joyless direction.

Title: Drive Angry
Actors: Nicolas Cage, Amber Heard, William Fichtner, Billy Burke
Plot: A vengeful father escapes from hell and chases after the men who killed his daughter and kidnapped his granddaughter.
tomatoConsensus: It may deliver the over-the-top action pieces, but Drive Angry prefers to work safely within grindhouse formula than do something truly unique.

Title: Battlefield Earth
Writer: Corey Mandell (screenplay), J.D. Shapiro (screenplay), L. Ron Hubbard (novel)
Actors: John Travolta, Barry Pepper, Forest Whitaker, Kim Coates
Plot: After enslavement & near extermination by an alien race in the year 3000, humanity begins to fight back.
tomatoConsensus: Ugly, campy, and poorly acted, Battlefield Earth is a stunningly misguided, aggressively bad sci-fi folly.

Title: All About Steve
Actors: Sandra Bullock, Thomas Haden Church, Bradley Cooper, Ken Jeong
Plot: Convinced that a CCN cameraman is her true love, an eccentric crossword puzzler trails him as he travels all over the country, hoping to convince him that they belong together.
tomatoConsensus: All About Steve is an oddly creepy, sour film, featuring a heroine so desperate and peculiar that audiences may be more likely to pity than root for her.

Title: Sucker Punch
Writer: Zack Snyder (screenplay), Steve Shibuya (screenplay), Zack Snyder (story)
Actors: Emily Browning, Abbie Cornish, Jena Malone, Vanessa Hudgens
Plot: A young girl is institutionalized by her abusive stepfather. Retreating to an alternative reality as a coping strategy, she envisions a plan which will help her escape from the mental facility.
tomatoConsensus: It's technically impressive and loaded with eye-catching images, but without characters or a plot to support them, all of Sucker Punch's visual thrills are for naught.

Title: Fast Five
Actors: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jordana Brewster, Tyrese Gibson
Plot: Dominic Toretto and his crew of street racers plan a massive heist to buy their freedom while in the sights of a powerful Brazilian drug lord and a dangerous federal agent.
tomatoConsensus: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.

Title: Mac and Me
Actors: Christine Ebersole, Jonathan Ward, Tina Caspary, Lauren Stanley
Plot: A Mysterious Alien Creature (MAC ?) trying to escape from NASA is befriended by a young boy in a wheel chair.
tomatoConsensus: Mac and Me is duly infamous: not only is it a pale imitation of E.T., it's also a thinly-veiled feature length commercial for McDonalds and Coca-Cola.

Title: The Tourist
Writer: Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck (screenplay), Christopher McQuarrie (screenplay), Julian Fellowes (screenplay), Jérôme Salle (motion picture "Anthony Zimmer")
Actors: Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie, Paul Bettany, Timothy Dalton
Plot: Revolves around Frank, an American tourist visiting Italy to mend a broken heart. Elise is an extraordinary woman who deliberately crosses his path.
Awards: Nominated for 3 Golden Globes. Another 3 wins & 2 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: The scenery and the stars are undeniably beautiful, but they can't make up for The Tourist's slow, muddled plot, or the lack of chemistry between Johnny Depp and Angelina Jolie.

Title: The Love Guru
Actors: Jessica Simpson, Kanye West, Mike Myers, Deepak Chopra
Plot: Pitka an American raised outside of his country by gurus, returns to the States in order to break into the self-help business. His first challenge: To settle the romantic troubles and subsequent professional skid of a star hockey player whose wife left him for a rival athlete.
tomatoConsensus: The Love Guru features far too many gross-out gags, and too few earned laughs, ranking as one of Mike Myers' poorest outings.

Title: Crank: High Voltage
Actors: Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Dwight Yoakam, Efren Ramirez
Plot: Chelios faces a Chinese mobster who has stolen his nearly indestructible heart and replaced it with a battery-powered ticker that requires regular jolts of electricity to keep working.
tomatoConsensus: Crank: High Voltage delivers on its promises: a fast-paced, exciting thrill ride that doesn't take itself too seriously.

Title: Green Lantern
Writer: Greg Berlanti (screenplay), Michael Green (screenplay), Marc Guggenheim (screenplay), Michael Goldenberg (screenplay), Greg Berlanti (screen story), Michael Green (screen story), Marc Guggenheim (screen story)
Actors: Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Peter Sarsgaard, Mark Strong
Plot: A test pilot, Hal Jordan, is granted an alien ring that bestows him with otherworldly powers that inducts him into an intergalactic police force, the Green Lantern Corps.
tomatoConsensus: Noisy, overproduced, and thinly written, Green Lantern squanders an impressive budget and decades of comics mythology.

Title: The Back-up Plan
Actors: Jennifer Lopez, Alex O'Loughlin, Michaela Watkins, Eric Christian Olsen
Plot: A romantic comedy centered on a woman who conceives twins through artificial insemination, only to meet the man of her dreams on the very same day.
tomatoConsensus: Jennifer Lopez is as appealing as ever, but The Back-Up Plan smothers its star with unrelatable characters and a predictable plot.

Title: The Smurfs
Writer: J. David Stem (screenplay), David N. Weiss (screenplay), Jay Scherick (screenplay), David Ronn (screenplay), J. David Stem (story), David N. Weiss (story), Peyo (characters)
Actors: Hank Azaria, Neil Patrick Harris, Jayma Mays, Sofía Vergara
Plot: When the evil wizard Gargamel chases the tiny blue Smurfs out of their village, they tumble from their magical world into New York City.
tomatoConsensus: The Smurfs assembles an undeniably talented cast of voice actors and live-action stars -- then crushes them beneath a blue mound of lowest-common-denominator kiddie fare.

Title: Skyline
Actors: Eric Balfour, Scottie Thompson, Brittany Daniel, Crystal Reed
Plot: Strange lights descend on the city of Los Angeles, drawing people outside like moths to a flame where an extraterrestrial force threatens to swallow the entire human population off the face of the Earth.
tomatoConsensus: A middling sci-fi entry, Skyline offers proof that solid special effects alone cannot overcome a flat storyline filled with uninspired dialogue.

Title: Gigli
Actors: Ben Affleck, Terry Camilleri, David Backus, Lenny Venito
Plot: The violent story about how a criminal lesbian, a tough-guy hit-man with a heart of gold, and a mentally challenged man came to be best friends through a hostage.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: The Wicker Man
Actors: Nicolas Cage, Ellen Burstyn, Kate Beahan, Frances Conroy
Plot: A sheriff investigating the disappearance of a young girl from a small island discovers there's a larger mystery to solve among the island's secretive, neo-pagan community.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: Punisher: War Zone
Writer: Nick Santora, Art Marcum, Matt Holloway
Actors: Ray Stevenson, Dominic West, Doug Hutchison, Colin Salmon
Plot: After hunting down and killing hundreds of violent criminals, Frank Castle, aka The Punisher, faces his most deadly foe yet: Jigsaw.
tomatoConsensus: Punisher: War Zone recalls the excessively violent, dialogue-challenged actioners of the 1980s, and coincidentally feels two decades out of date.

Title: I Know Who Killed Me
Actors: Bonnie Aarons, Lindsay Lohan, Michael Adler, Julia Ormond
Plot: A young girl who was missing reappears, but she claims to be someone else entirely.
tomatoConsensus: Distasteful and ludicrously plotted, I Know Who Killed Me is a career nadir for all involved -- particularly Lindsay Lohan in a dual role.

Title: Leprechaun in the Hood
Writer: Mark Jones (characters), William Wells (story), Alan Reynolds (story), Rob Spera (story), Doug Hall (story), Doug Hall (screenplay), Jon Huffman (screenplay)
Actors: Warwick Davis, Ice-T, Anthony Montgomery, Rashaan Nall
Plot: The Leprechaun ends up in the inner city, Compton, CA. More comedy than horror fill this installment.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: The Room
Actors: Tommy Wiseau, Juliette Danielle, Greg Sestero, Philip Haldiman
Plot: Johnny is a successful banker who lives happily in a San Francisco townhouse with his fiancée, Lisa. One day, inexplicably, she gets bored of him and decides to seduce Johnny's best friend, Mark. From there, nothing will be the same again.
tomatoConsensus: A bona fide classic of midnight cinema, Tommy Wiseau's misguided masterpiece subverts the rules of filmmaking with a boundless enthusiasm that renders such mundanities as acting, screenwriting, and cinematography utterly irrelevant. You will never see a football the same way again.

Title: Superman III
Writer: Joe Shuster (character created by: Superman), Jerry Siegel (character created by: Superman), David Newman (screenplay), Leslie Newman (screenplay)
Actors: Christopher Reeve, Richard Pryor, Jackie Cooper, Marc McClure
Plot: Synthetic kryptonite laced with tobacco tar splits Superman in two: good Clark Kent and bad Man of Steel.
tomatoConsensus: When not overusing sight gags, slapstick, and Richard Pryor, Superman III resorts to plot points rehashed from the previous Superman flicks.

Title: Catwoman
Writer: Bob Kane (characters), Theresa Rebeck (story), John D. Brancato (story), Michael Ferris (story), John D. Brancato (screenplay), Michael Ferris (screenplay), John Rogers (screenplay)
Actors: Halle Berry, Benjamin Bratt, Sharon Stone, Lambert Wilson
Plot: A shy woman, endowed with the speed, reflexes, and senses of a cat, walks a thin line between criminal and hero, even as a detective doggedly pursues her, fascinated by both of her personas.
tomatoConsensus: Halle Berry is the lone bright spot, but even she can't save this laughable action thriller.

Title: Jingle All the Way
Actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Phil Hartman, Rita Wilson
Plot: A father needs to get a Turbo Man action figure for his son just before Christmas. Unfotunately, every store is sold out of Turbo Man figures, and he must travel all over town and compete with everybody else to find a Turbo Man figure.
tomatoConsensus: Arnold Schwarzenegger tries his best, but Jingle All the Way suffers from an uneven tone, shifting wildly from a would-be satire on materialism to an antic, slapstick yuk-fest.

Title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
Actors: Taylor Lautner, Gil Birmingham, Billy Burke, Sarah Clarke
Plot: The Quileutes close in on expecting parents Edward and Bella, whose unborn child poses a threat to the Wolf Pack and the towns people of Forks.
tomatoConsensus: Slow, joyless, and loaded with unintentionally humorous moments, Breaking Dawn Part 1 may satisfy the Twilight faithful, but it's strictly for fans of the franchise.

Title: Crank
Actors: Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Jose Pablo Cantillo, Efren Ramirez
Plot: Professional assassin Chev Chelios learns his rival has injected him with a poison that will kill him if his heart rate drops.
tomatoConsensus: It's a film about a guy injected with Speed... wait, there's no bus. It's a film about a guy who has to kick a bunch of squirmy butt to stay alive... wait, no snakes or planes here. But it is a film about doing lots of drugs and pulling lots of punches, and it entertains accordingly.

Title: Trespass
Actors: Nicolas Cage, Nicole Kidman, Ben Mendelsohn, Liana Liberato
Plot: As they're held for ransom, a husband and wife's predicament grows more dire amid the discovery of betrayal and deception.
tomatoConsensus: Another claustrophobic thriller that Joel Schumacher can churn out in his sleep, Trespass is nasty and aggressive, more unpleasant than entertaining.

Title: Cool as Ice
Actors: Naomi Campbell, Vanilla Ice, Deezer D, Kevin Hicks
Plot: A rap-oriented remake of "The Wild One", with heavy emphasis on the fact that rap star Vanilla Ice has assumed the Marlon Brando role.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: Birdemic: Shock and Terror
Actors: Alan Bagh, Whitney Moore, Tippi Hedren, Janae Caster
Plot: A platoon of eagles and vultures attacks the residents of a small town. Many people die. It's not known what caused the flying menace to attack. Two people manage to fight back, but will they survive Birdemic?
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: 88 Minutes
Actors: Al Pacino, Alicia Witt, Leelee Sobieski, Amy Brenneman
Plot: On the day that a serial killer that he helped put away is supposed to be executed, a noted forensic psychologist and college professor receives a call informing him that he has 88 minutes left to live.
tomatoConsensus: 88 Minutes is a shockingly inept psychological thriller that expertly squanders the talent at hand.

Title: Abduction
Actors: Alfred Molina, Maria Bello, Jason Isaacs, Denzel Whitaker
Plot: A thriller centered on a young man who sets out to uncover the truth about his life after finding his baby photo on a missing persons website.
tomatoConsensus: A soulless and incompetent action/thriller not even a veteran lead actor could save, let alone Taylor Lautner.

Title: The Adventures of Pluto Nash
Actors: Eddie Murphy, Randy Quaid, Rosario Dawson, Joe Pantoliano
Plot: In the future, a man struggles to keep his lunar nightclub out of the hands of the mafia.
tomatoConsensus: The Adventures of Pluto Nash is neither adventurous nor funny, and Eddie Murphy is on autopilot in this notorious box office bomb.

Title: Tiptoes
Actors: Gary Oldman, Peter Dinklage, Kate Beckinsale, Matthew McConaughey
Plot: Two brothers - a dwarf (Rolfe) and one normal-sized (Steve). When Steve's girlfriend Carol becomes pregnant, the pair are fearful that the baby will inherit the dwarfism gene. Matters are ...
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: On the Line
Actors: Lance Bass, Joey Fatone, Emmanuelle Chriqui, GQ
Plot: A shy advertising employee meets his dream girl on the El train, but doesn't remember to get her phone number, resulting in an all-out search for the mystery girl
tomatoConsensus: An inept attempt at a romantic comedy aimed at 'Nsync fans.

Title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
Writer: Graham Yost (characters), Jan de Bont (story), Randall McCormick (story), Randall McCormick (screenplay), Jeff Nathanson (screenplay)
Actors: Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric, Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison
Plot: A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker.
tomatoConsensus: Speed 2 falls far short of its predecessor, thanks to laughable dialogue, thin characterization, unsurprisingly familiar plot devices, and action sequences that fail to generate any excitement.

Title: Bad Ass
Actors: Danny Trejo, Charles S. Dutton, Patrick Fabian, Joyful Drake
Plot: A Vietnam veteran who becomes a local hero after saving a man from attackers on a city bus decides to take action when his best friend is murdered and the police show little interest in solving the crime.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: Godzilla
Writer: Dean Devlin (screenplay), Roland Emmerich (screenplay), Ted Elliott (story), Terry Rossio (story), Dean Devlin (story), Roland Emmerich (story)
Actors: Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo, Hank Azaria
Plot: An enormous, radioactively mutated lizard runs rampant in Manhattan.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Title: Judge Dredd
Writer: John Wagner (characters), Carlos Ezquerra (characters), Michael De Luca (story), William Wisher Jr. (story), William Wisher Jr. (screenplay), Steven E. de Souza (screenplay)
Actors: Sylvester Stallone, Armand Assante, Rob Schneider, Jürgen Prochnow
Plot: In a dystopian future, Joseph Dredd, the most famous Judge (a police officer with instant field judiciary powers) is convicted for a crime he did not commit while his murderous counterpart escapes.
tomatoConsensus: Judge Dredd wants to be both a legitimate violent action flick and a parody of one, but director Danny Cannon fails to find the necessary balance to make it work.

Title: Spider-Man 3
Writer: Sam Raimi (screenplay), Ivan Raimi (screenplay), Alvin Sargent (screenplay), Sam Raimi (screen story), Ivan Raimi (screen story), Stan Lee (Marvel comic book), Steve Ditko (Marvel comic book)
Actors: Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, James Franco, Thomas Haden Church
Plot: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.
Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 1 win & 28 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Though there are more characters and plotlines, and the action sequences still dazzle, Spider-Man 3 nonetheless isn't quite as refined as the first two.

Title: Batman & Robin
Actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, George Clooney, Chris O'Donnell, Uma Thurman
Plot: Batman & Robin try to keep their relationship together even as they must stop Mr. Freeze and Poison Ivy from freezing Gotham City.
tomatoConsensus: Joel Schumacher's tongue-in-cheek attitude hits an unbearable limit in Batman & Robin resulting in a frantic and mindless movie that's too jokey to care much for.

Title: Wild Wild West
Writer: Jim Thomas (story), John Thomas (story), S.S. Wilson (screenplay), Brent Maddock (screenplay), Jeffrey Price (screenplay), Peter S. Seaman (screenplay)
Actors: Will Smith, Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Salma Hayek
Plot: The two best hired guns in the West must save President Grant from the clutches of a 19th century inventor-villain.
tomatoConsensus: Bombastic, manic, and largely laugh-free, Wild Wild West is a bizarre misfire in which greater care was lavished upon the special effects than on the script.

Title: Jaws: The Revenge
Actors: Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest, Mario Van Peebles, Karen Young
Plot: Chief Brody's widow believes that her family is deliberately being targeted by another shark in search of revenge.
tomatoConsensus: Illogical, tension-free, and filled with cut-rate special effects, Jaws 4 - The Revenge is a sorry chapter in a once-proud franchise.

Title: Road House
Writer: David Lee Henry (story), David Lee Henry (screenplay), Hilary Henkin (screenplay)

Plot: A tough bouncer is hired to tame a dirty bar.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Plot: Slightly traumatized and painfully shy Angela Baker is sent away to summer camp with her cousin. Not long after Angela's arrival, things start to go horribly wrong for anyone with sinister or less than honorable intentions.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

tomatoConsensus: N/A

Plot: After the birth of Renesmee, the Cullens gather other vampire clans in order to protect the child from a false allegation that puts the family in front of the Volturi.
tomatoConsensus: It's the most entertaining Twilight, but that's not enough to make Breaking Dawn Part 2 worth watching for filmgoers who don't already count themselves among the franchise converts.

Title: Liz & Dick
Actors: Lindsay Lohan, Grant Bowler, Theresa Russell, David Hunt
Plot: The torrid relationship between Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Primetime Emmys. Another 1 win.
tomatoConsensus: N/A

Plot: After assuming his dead cellmate's identity to get with his girlfriend, an ex-con finds himself the reluctant participant in a casino heist.

Title: Anaconda

Plot: A childless couple bury a box in their backyard, containing all of their wishes for an infant. Soon, a child is born, though Timothy Green is not all that he appears.
tomatoConsensus: It means well, but The Odd Life of Timothy Green is ultimately too cloyingly sentimental -- and thinly scripted -- to satisfy all but the least demanding viewers.

Title: Devil's Advocate
Writer: Andrew Neiderman (novel), Jonathan Lemkin (screenplay), Tony Gilroy (screenplay)

Plot: An exceptionally adept Florida lawyer is offered a job to work in New York City for a high-end law firm with a high-end boss - the biggest opportunity of his career to date.
tomatoConsensus: Though it is ultimately somewhat undone by its own lofty ambitions, The Devil's Advocate is a mostly effective blend of supernatural thrills and character exploration.

Plot: A waitress from Texas and a college student from Pennsylvania meet during spring break in Fort Lauderdale, Florida and come together through their shared love of singing.
tomatoConsensus: A notorious stinker, From Justin To Kelly features banal songs, a witless plot, and non-existent chemistry between its American Idol-sanctioned leads.

tomatoConsensus: Featuring mostly wooden performances, laughable dialogue, and shoddy production values, In the Name of the King fulfills all expectations of an Uwe Boll film.

tomatoConsensus: Though it offers mild entertainment through campy one-liners and the overacting of the late Raul Julia, Street Fighter's nonstop action sequences are not enough to make up for a predictable, uneven storyline.

tomatoConsensus: Joyful Noise's musical numbers are solidly entertaining, and it benefits from Queen Latifah and Dolly Parton's sizable chemistry; unfortunately, they aren't enough to make up for the rest of the film.

Title: Fast & Furious 6

Plot: Hobbs has Dominic and Brian reassemble their crew to take down a team of mercenaries: Dominic unexpectedly gets convoluted also facing his presumed deceased girlfriend, Letty.
tomatoConsensus: With high-octane humor and terrific action scenes, Fast & Furious 6 builds upon the winning blockbuster formula that made Fast 5 a critical and commercial success.

tomatoConsensus: After Earth is a dull, ploddingly paced exercise in sentimental sci-fi -- and the latest setback for director M. Night Shyamalan's once-promising career.
